commitResults.messageTitle: Added Add to List and List feature.
Added Mark as Done/Not Done feature.

commitResults.messageBody:
Duke is running on data that is not saved and resets every time the
Duke program is rerun.

Tasks should be saved and used for future rerun of Duke for the users.

Let's add a folder with a text file and call Scanner class to read the
text file and FileWriter class to write in the text file.

Using Scanner class to read the text file and FileWriter class to write
 in the text file helps to store task in a text file as expected.

The toString method in Deadline class prints the deadline in a String
format provided by the user.

The toString method should print in the mmm-dd-yyyy format instead of a
string.

Let's import the LocalDate class and parse in the date to the var by.
Use the var by of type LocalDate to print the date in mmm-dd-yyyy format
.

LocalDate class helps to provide a format that can be printed out for
the user.

Program is cluttered in static main with little OOP.

Program code looks untidy with no OOP in mind.

Let's add more OOP classes such as Parser to deal with making sense of
the user command, Storage to deal with loading tasks from the file and
saving tasks in the file, TaskList to contain the task list and UI to
deal with user interactions.

These classes can help to further categorize the different objects in
an OOP way which makes the code more readable.
